bug module

class bug.BugReport(target: str, endpoint: str, vuln_type: str, severity: str)

Bases: object

Represents a bug bounty report containing information about a target, endpoint, vulnerability type, and severity.

Validates the target field using a regular expression and normalizes the severity field to lowercase.

Parameters:

  • target (str) – The domain name of the target (e.g., “example.com”).

  • endpoint (str) – The path where the vulnerability was found (e.g., “/login”).

  • vuln_type (str) – Type of the vulnerability (e.g., “XSS”, “SQLi”).

  • severity (str) – Severity level of the bug (“low”, “medium”, “high”, “critical”).

Raises:

InvalidBugError – If the target domain does not match the required format.

VALID_SEVERITIES = {'critical', 'high', 'low', 'medium'}
property target: str

Gets the validated target domain.

Returns:

The domain name of the target.

Return type:

str

to_dict() → dict

Converts the bug report instance into a dictionary.

Returns:

Dictionary containing bug report fields.

Return type:

dict

exception bug.InvalidBugError

Bases: Exception

Custom exception raised when a bug report’s field fails validation, such as when the target domain is not properly formatted.
